intro: Hieracium mikulinkae, commonly known as the Mikulinka's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are generally hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium mikulinkae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
